text:
Police Powers (Surveillance Devices) (Corresponding Laws) Regulations 2021

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, make the following regulations under the Police Powers (Surveillance Devices) Act 2006 .

13 December 2021

B. BAKER

Governor

By Her Excellency's Command,

ELISE ARCHER

Minister for Justice

1. Short title
    These regulations may be cited as the Police Powers (Surveillance Devices) (Corresponding Laws) Regulations 2021 .

2. Commencement
    These regulations take effect on the day on which their making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Corresponding laws
    For the purposes of the definition of corresponding law in section 3(1) of the Police Powers (Surveillance Devices) Act 2006 , the following laws of other jurisdictions are declared to correspond to that Act:
            (a) Crimes (Surveillance Devices) Act 2010 of the Australian Capital Territory;
            (b) Surveillance Devices Act 2007 of New South Wales;
            (c) Surveillance Devices Act 2007 of the Northern Territory;
            (d) Chapter 13 of the Police Powers and Responsibilities Act 2000 of Queensland;
            (e) Surveillance Devices Act 2016 of South Australia;
            (f) Surveillance Devices Act 1999 of Victoria;
            (g) Surveillance Devices Act 2004 of the Commonwealth.

4. Legislation rescinded
    The legislation specified in Schedule 1 is rescinded.

SCHEDULE 1 - Legislation rescinded

Regulation 4

Police Powers (Surveillance Devices) (Corresponding Laws) Regulations 2010 (No. 154 of 2010)
                                                                                            


Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 22 December 2021

These regulations are administered in the Department of Justice.
